page.title: 11HOXTON MARKET IN HACKNEY
page.content: Hoxton is a very busy place especially on Saturdays. The first stall arrives at dawn. As the morning wears on more stalls appear and the place is now packed with customers. The smell of greasy chips lingers in the air. There are lots of different stalls selling both new and secondhand clothes as well as fruit and vegetable and antique stores. There is often a busker singing outside the butcher's shop. The market stall-holders and the customers seem happy. Sometimes they sit in deck chairs for a rest after doing their shopping in Hoxton Gardens. On Sundays Hoxton is very quiet but I prefer the hustle and bustle of market days.
